intro: Lophiolepis sipylea, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has a compact, mat-forming growth habit with narrow, linear leaves. Lophiolepis sipylea is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
